perturbation.original_text: This Remarketing Agreement is dated as of August 26, 2014 (this "Remarketing Agreement"), among MetLife, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the "Company"), and Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. ("Deutsche Bank") (the "Remarketing Agents," which expression shall include any institution appointed as a Remarketing Agent in accordance with Section 8 hereof), and Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, not individually but solely as Stock Purchase Contract Agent (as defined below) and as attorney-in-fact of the holders of Stock Purchase Contracts (as defined below). The Company and the Remarketing Agents will enter into a Pricing Agreement, to be dated the Remarketing Date (as defined below) (the "Pricing Agreement"), which will set forth, inter alia, the final terms of the Remarketed Securities (as defined below) and the Remarketing Fee (as defined below). The Remarketing Agents are undertaking to remarket Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 1, due 2018 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "First Tranche Series E Debt Securities") and Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 2, due 2045 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities"), whose terms will each be modified in the event of a Successful Remarketing (as defined below), as provided in the notice of remarketing from the Company, dated August 26, 2014 (the "Notice") pursuant to Section 3.3(a) of the Twenty-Second Supplemental Indenture (as defined below) and Section 5.2(a)(iv) of the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement (as defined below) (such securities, as so modified from and after a Successful Remarketing (whether or not such securities were remarketed by the Remarketing Agents), the "Securities"). Upon a Successful Remarketing, the Stated Maturity (as defined in the Indenture (as defined below)) of the First Tranche Series E Debt Securities will, effective October 8, 2014, automatically be adjusted to December 15, 2017 and the Stated Maturity of the Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities will, effective October 8, 2014, automatically be adjusted to December 15, 2044.

perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that upon a Successful Remarketing, the Stated Maturity of the First and Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities WILL automatically be adjusted to December 15, 2017 and December 15, 2044, respectively. perturbation.original_text:
1. Appointment and Obligations of the Remarketing Agents. (a) The Company hereby appoints Deutsche Bank as the initial Remarketing Agent, and Deutsche Bank hereby accepts appointment as Remarketing Agent, for the purpose of (i) Remarketing the Remarketed Securities on behalf of the holders thereof, (ii) establishing the Reset Rates (as defined below) for the Securities in connection with the Remarketing and (iii) performing such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with and pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures.

(b) The Remarketing Agents agree (i) to use commercially reasonable efforts to remarket the Remarketed Securities tendered or deemed tendered to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing, (ii) to establish the Reset Rates in accordance with the Remarketing Procedures and to notify the Company, the Trustee and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent promptly of the Reset Rates and (iii) to carry out such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with the provisions of the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Appointment and Obligations of the Remarketing Agents. (a) The Company hereby appoints Deutsche Bank as the initial Remarketing Agent, and Deutsche Bank hereby accepts appointment as Remarketing Agent, for the purpose of (i) Remarketing the Remarketed Securities on behalf of the holders thereof, (ii) establishing the Reset Rates (as defined below) for the Securities in connection with the Remarketing and (iii) performing such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with and pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures.

(b) The Remarketing Agents may agree (i) to use commercially reasonable efforts to remarket the Remarketed Securities tendered or deemed tendered to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing, (ii) to establish the Reset Rates in accordance with the Remarketing Procedures if they see fit and to notify the Company, the Trustee and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent promptly of the Reset Rates and (iii) to carry out some of the other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with the provisions of the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.explanation: Section 1 outlines the 'Obligations of the Remarketing Agents.' By changing 'agree' to 'may agree' and inserting subjective wording like 'if they see fit' and 'some of the other duties', the modified text now suggests that the Remarketing Agents' commitment to using commercially reasonable efforts, establishing Reset Rates, and carrying out other duties is discretionary. This directly contradicts the initial statement of 'Obligations,' creating confusion and potential disputes regarding the extent of their required actions.

perturbation.original_text: The Company and each Significant Subsidiary has all necessary Approvals of and from, and has made all filings, registrations and declarations (collectively, the "Filings") with, all insurance regulatory authorities, all Federal, state, local and other governmental authorities, all self-regulatory organizations and all courts and other tribunals, which are necessary to own, lease, license and use its properties and assets and to conduct its business in the manner described in the Disclosure Package, except where the failure to have such Approvals or to make such Filings would not have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect; to the knowledge of the Company, the Company and each Significant Subsidiary is in compliance with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, orders, by-laws and similar requirements, including in connection with registrations or memberships in self-regulatory organizations, and all such Approvals and Filings are in full force and effect and neither the Company nor any Significant Subsidiary has received any notice of any event, inquiry, investigation or proceeding that would reasonably be expected to result in the suspension, revocation or limitation of any such Approval or otherwise impose any limitation on the conduct of the business of the Company or any Significant Subsidiary, except as described in the Disclosure Package or except for any such non-compliance, suspension, revocation or limitation which would not have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and each Significant Subsidiary must try to have all necessary Approvals of and from, and to make all filings, registrations and declarations (collectively, the "Filings") with, all insurance regulatory authorities, all Federal, state, local and other governmental authorities, all self-regulatory organizations and all courts and other tribunals, which are necessary to own, lease, license and use its properties and assets and to conduct its business in the manner described in the Disclosure Package, except where the failure to have such Approvals or to make such Filings would not have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect; the Company makes no promises about the the Company and each Significant Subsidiary is in compliance with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, orders, by-laws and similar requirements, including in connection with registrations or memberships in self-regulatory organizations, and it is possible that all such Approvals and Filings are not in full force and effect and the Company and each Significant Subsidiary may have received notice of any event, inquiry, investigation or proceeding that would reasonably be expected to result in the suspension, revocation or limitation of any such Approval or otherwise impose any limitation on the conduct of the business of the Company or any Significant Subsidiary, except as described in the Disclosure Package or except for any such non-compliance, suspension, revocation or limitation which would not have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the initial firm assertion to 'must try to have' and 'makes no promises,' the modified text significantly weakens the Company's representation about holding necessary approvals and being in compliance. The explicit disclaimer creates a contradiction, suggesting the company might not actually possess all required approvals or comply with all regulations. This introduces risk and uncertainty, as it implies that critical operational aspects might be unapproved or non-compliant.
